record.description: Foster Hall was one of three dormitories for women completed by October 1893 at the University of Chicago. It was named for Nancy Foster. Kelly and Beecher Halls, the two other women's residences, were named respectively for Elizabeth Green Kelly, and Mary Beecher. Recently remolded, the Foster Hall complex now serves students and professors as classrooms, offices, and laboratories. Professor Francis W. Shepard son presented the photograph to the University Library in 1917.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Negative on file.Photograph is faded and mounted on cardboard. Stamp: Please return to Office of Public Relations University of Chicago. Caption is glued to the back.
